transportAdvice: Jeddah has a limited public bus network that does not comprehensively cover most tourist areas, so taxis and ride-hailing services are the most practical way to get around; walking is feasible along the Corniche waterfront but the city is otherwise spread out and the heat makes pedestrian travel uncomfortable for much of the year.

weather.description: Mild and pleasant winter weather with comfortable temperatures and occasional light showers.
Warm and mostly dry with gentle breezes making it one of the more comfortable months to visit.
Temperatures begin to rise noticeably but conditions remain relatively pleasant for outdoor sightseeing.
Getting hot with increasing humidity; mornings and evenings are more comfortable than midday.
Hot and humid conditions set in; outdoor activities are best limited to early morning or after sunset.
Intense heat and high humidity make daytime outdoor activity uncomfortable; air-conditioned venues are essential.
Peak summer heat with oppressive humidity; most activity shifts indoors or to the cooler evening hours.
Conditions remain extremely hot and humid, similar to July; not an ideal time for outdoor exploration.
Still very hot and humid with little relief; slight easing toward the end of the month.
Temperatures begin to moderate and humidity eases, making outdoor sightseeing more manageable.
Pleasantly warm weather returns with lower humidity, one of the better months for visiting.
Mild and comfortable winter conditions with cool evenings and minimal rainfall.
